verses.verse: A Song <S%H7892><s%> or Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of Asaph <S%H623><s%>. Keep not thou silence <S%H1824><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>: hold not thy peace <S%H2790><s%>, and be not still <S%H8252><s%>, O God <S%H410><s%>. of Asaph: or, for Asaph
For, lo, thine enemies <S%H341><s%> make a tumult <S%H1993><s%>: and they that hate <S%H8130><s%> thee have lifted up <S%H5375><s%> the head <S%H7218><s%>.
They have taken crafty <S%H6191><s%> counsel <S%H5475><s%> against thy people <S%H5971><s%>, and consulted <S%H3289><s%> against thy hidden ones <S%H6845><s%>.

They have said <S%H559><s%>, Come <S%H3212><s%>, and let us cut them off <S%H3582><s%> from being a nation <S%H1471><s%>; that the name <S%H8034><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> may be no more in remembrance <S%H2142><s%>.
For they have consulted <S%H3289><s%> together <S%H3162><s%> with one consent <S%H3820><s%>: they are <S%H3772><s%> confederate <S%H1285><s%> against thee: consent: Heb. heart
The tabernacles <S%H168><s%> of Edom <S%H123><s%>, and the Ishmaelites <S%H3459><s%>; of Moab <S%H4124><s%>, and the Hagarenes <S%H1905><s%>;
Gebal <S%H1381><s%>, and Ammon <S%H5983><s%>, and Amalek <S%H6002><s%>; the Philistines <S%H6429><s%> with the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Tyre <S%H6865><s%>;
Assur <S%H804><s%> also is joined <S%H3867><s%> with them: they have holpen <S%H2220><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Lot <S%H3876><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>. holpen: Heb. been an arm to
Do <S%H6213><s%> unto them as unto the Midianites <S%H4080><s%>; as to Sisera <S%H5516><s%>, as to Jabin <S%H2985><s%>, at the brook <S%H5158><s%> of Kison <S%H7028><s%>:
Which perished <S%H8045><s%> at Endor <S%H5874><s%>: they became as dung <S%H1828><s%> for the earth <S%H127><s%>.
Make <S%H7896><s%> their nobles <S%H5081><s%> like Oreb <S%H6159><s%>, and like Zeeb <S%H2062><s%>: yea, all their princes <S%H5257><s%> as Zebah <S%H2078><s%>, and as Zalmunna <S%H6759><s%>:
Who said <S%H559><s%>, Let us take to ourselves the houses <S%H4999><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> in possession <S%H3423><s%>.
O my God <S%H430><s%>, make <S%H7896><s%> them like a wheel <S%H1534><s%>; as the stubble <S%H7179><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%>.
As the fire <S%H784><s%> burneth <S%H1197><s%> a wood <S%H3293><s%>, and as the flame <S%H3852><s%> setteth <S%H3857><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%> on fire <S%H3857><s%>;
So persecute <S%H7291><s%> them with thy tempest <S%H5591><s%>, and make them afraid <S%H926><s%> with thy storm <S%H5492><s%>.
Fill <S%H4390><s%> their faces <S%H6440><s%> with shame <S%H7036><s%>; that they may seek <S%H1245><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
Let them be confounded <S%H954><s%> and troubled <S%H926><s%> for ever <S%H5703><s%>; yea, let them be put to shame <S%H2659><s%>, and perish <S%H6><s%>:
That men may know <S%H3045><s%> that thou, whose name <S%H8034><s%> alone is JEHOVAH <S%H3068><s%>, art the most high <S%H5945><s%> over all the earth <S%H776><s%>.
